speaker: Bellows
lines: Leather lungs breathe in and out; the fire remembers being a dragon.
Soot writes family trees on the rafters.
A pulley squeaks on purpose to feel included.
You pull and the forge says 'more' and then 'enough'.
The heat kisses your knuckles and decides not to bite.
A nail falls and stands upright between boards, thinking.
Sweat draws a map on your arms; the path ends at your hands.
You understand why bellows talk in pairs.

choices.text: Stoke the fire for a midnight heat.
Step outside to cool at the slag heap.
